batch_goal_summary: Literature-first alpha banking for AAAHFT ES (CME) TBBO research. Objective: produce a high-quality, auditable Alpha Bank (hypothesis inventory) grounded in existing local PDFs/notes before doing any heavy backtest implementation. Inputs are local archives: `/Users/simongu/Downloads/Archive/HFT MM/` and `/Users/simongu/Downloads/Archive/Book/` plus curated paper folders under `/Users/simongu/Documents/fin_papers/papers/`. Constraints are binding and must be reflected in every hypothesis: no-lookahead via `ts_recv` visibility, one-way latency 1ms from signal to CME order update effective time, and cost $0.58 per side ($1.16 round trip) for both maker and taker. Data limitation: TBBO only (top-of-book + trade print fields), so deep-book/queue-position assumptions must be explicitly marked as not identifiable. Each agent owns a narrow slice (a themed subset of papers) and must produce two artifacts: (1) a markdown literature note with design implications and TBBO feasibility, and (2) a machine-readable YAML list of actionable hypotheses with parameter sweeps, failure-mode slices, and explicit cost-feasibility statements. Agents may use `pdfinfo`/`pdftotext` for local extraction but must not store full-paper text or paste large excerpts. No code changes beyond writing these research artifacts. Output per agent must be a valid Run Report JSON (schema_version=1.0.0) with required PROMPT_* feedback lines in the summary.
